title: Ask a climbing Mordekaiser main anything
body:
Hello folks, I only play Mordekaiser.
I think I'm pretty good at him. 
Here's the evidence on which I base my belief:

http://s1256.photobucket.com/user/backup4now/media/Screenshot%202016-03-03%2000.56.16_zpstitgqc6d.png.html

http://s1256.photobucket.com/user/backup4now/media/Screenshot%202016-03-03%2000.56.36_zpsbfzdw0p6.png.html

Why did I make this thread?

Because a lot of people believe Mordekaiser is shit right now. Those people are correct, but you should still play him because he's the best character in the game.

Also, general climbing tips for those that are below plat.

replies.body:
My question for you:

Have you ever played Mordekaiser top, and what are your reasons for not doing so?

I play morde top on occasion, and my reason for not doing it more often is because most top laners (and every single juggernaut) do the whole "if you stay in melee you die" aspect of Mordekaiser but better one-on-one. The level 2/3/4 melee stance early kills don't work when you're up against an illaoi or quinn or any melee damaging laner (that have brains). Especially quinn, she straight up does 2/3rds of morde's hp in 3 autos and a vault at level 1, even if he has shield.

I never play morde top in ranked because of this. However, in normals I still do and hope i'm up against a fedora or something.

I like it because there are very few instances of Morde losing a trade with a melee champion whilst his W is in effect. Because of that, I save W for the moment they decide to attack.

We share the same opinion about Quinn, though. That damned champion. And her vision reduction bug that causes empowered auto attacks to fail...

How high have you gone so far?

Have you tried him much in bot lane?

I've gone from silver 1 to plat 5 last season using him in the jungle and thresh support
This season I've gone from gold 5 to gold 2 (so far, just started ranking this season)  

I use him jungle mid and bot, all ap/off tank. Some of the games shown are in the bot lane, like the thornmail rush into banner of command game (spent all game turtling against what appeared to be two master smurfs with 90-95% winrates)

That's cool, I may have to bounce some build ideas off of you sometime when I get out of my promos.  Ranked never seemed worth it to me when I started at the end of season 3, but after an enemy complimented me during a game with the impression I was a gold smurf its kinda boosted my confidence to try climbing the ladder and see how I do.

I've been reluctant to play him anywhere but bot lane after his rework and because of that I've been having some success maining him there.  I've heard lots of good things about his jungling so that might just be a good secondary role for me if I get alittle practice.

Before you theorycraft @me, the thornmail banner of command build is bad. That was a joke build to troll their draven who was full of himself and kept calling me bad.
Take what you see in those pictures as a grain of salt

Rushing Thornmail doesnt sound all that good, maybe as a 4th or 5th item.  For what its worth I'm mix building Frozen Heart and Nashor's Tooth to start and that seems to be good enough to push me past the early game.

@Selegun

As another Platinum 'one trick pony' Mordekaiser player, I recommend switching up your armour items. Frozen Heart is less optimum than, say, Dead Man's Plate. :)

Nashor's Tooth is really good on Morde, as the Q doesn't go on cooldown until the last hit is spent. You will hit 6 Q's with Nashor's in the same time as a Morde without Nashor's is about to activate Q for the second time.

Try Rylai's sometime, as well. It's a very decent item on him.

I actually started with a Rylai's in my early builds but didnt like how it felt.  Yeah the slow was there and it gave some AP and HP but it just feels...lackluster.

While I respect your stance on Frozen Heart compared to deadmans I just cant give up that CDR.  Being able to spam my spells after 2 full items feels way more powerful and the extra 40 armor is very noticeable to me when trading with the enemy Marksman.

It's up to you, of course, but I would ask you to consider the health gain as well. Resistances and health scale together, not to mention the effect health has on your passive.

In theory, Frozen Heart can be a good pick, but when you consider how much gold is being spent on it... The other issue is that you're spending all that gold to counter AD. AP champions aren't stopped by armour at all, so it'll be like going without any items at all vs them, but health can help out, here.

The movement speed passive on Dead Man's is good, too. You can split a wave and come back to your team very quickly. And the CC on your first auto of the teamfight can lead to an easy front line ghost (or ADC if you have flash up or they're badly positioned).

On top of this, I'd buy such and item 5th or 6th. Morde needs to be building at least some form of damage from the start of the game, and there are lots of good bruiser items to choose from. For AD, I rush Seeker's. 1200 gold for decent armour and semi-decent AP. Much more cost efficient than Glacial Shroud on Morde, and you don't have to finish Seeker's into Zhonya's.

Its not that I dont value HP, I'm just opting into it in a different way than items.  HP per level seals and the strength of ages keystone make my first buy feel better than it normaly would be.  I feel you on glacial shroud, its not good to rush so i try to buy wardens mail and fiendish codex on first back.

I agree 100% that frozen heart doesnt help against AP.  However, because we are talking about Morde it does actualy have some defense due to his shield paired with 20% CDR.  

Deadmans plate is a good item and its in my alternative items tab just incase i need to worry about flat true damage.

Once more I agree with you, he does need some damage to get going but its an easy work around by keeping focus on objectives and denying the enemy marksman farm with proper use of your W.

I can not, for the life of me, understand why so many people want to pick nashors on Mordekaiser.
Cdr is good, AS is good, the little bonus damage is nice too. 
However, it has several innate problems. The bonus damage is only good with lots of ap, which you cannot attain with a nashors build because doing so would render you too squishy to survive. Building it first means your q is all of your burst. Building it last means you got to late without it and it won't help. While having this item makes your Q burst good, you have to rely on getting in range for it. Getting in range isn't good because it leaves you vulnerable to attack/kiting/focus, which is bad since you're squishy since you built nashors.

Do it if you find success in it, but I would avoid it at all costs. AS runes are better for that purpose imo.

And the deadmans is good advice. Lord knows Morde needs that speed.

That is because you play a different playstyle, which involves more burst damage. People who run Nashor's, including myself and certain other diamond Morde mains, do a tankier build. We include Rylai's and Stormraider's in our kits so hitting Q's is easy. We build around surviving enough to hit lots of Q's in fights, whilst building as much damage as we can get away with without going pop at the start of teamfights. Usually, it involves two of the following items: Seeker's, Abyssal, Rylai's or Sterak's. Then Nashor's, one more of those bruiser items, then a full tank item, such as Deadman's.

For your playstyle, which there are also diamond Morde mains who follow, I would not recommend Nashor's for the same reasons you have spoken against it. That playstyle does not revolve around Q's.

I pick it to mitigate the double cooldown worked into his Q.  I understand exactly why you might shy away from trusting your damage on a melee ability but I deeply enjoy this playstyle as it forces me to think more tactically about the rift.  Finding ways to force the enemy to get close to you has a satisfaction to it that makes me smile in a way playing Ahri, Caitlin or even Zac just never can.
Far too spooky for me.  I'd get 30% cdr runes and lucidity before buying a squishy item for melee damage purposes. I don't have the maksi to challenge range characters like that.

It takes alot of practice and its very easy to botch the early game.   Finding good places to fight is key, typically around Dragon or around enemy jungle camps for the collateral shield generation.  Range will often give you trouble but being able to count on at least one of your team to pick an assassin of some sort to chase them down for the kill or even just zoneing them away during lategame for your team is all you need.

Cant afford to take CDR runes since I'm using those slots for HP and build acceleration.

Bro take cleanse it's way better than ignite(see my post to learn more about this)
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/446F9jpU-mordekaiser-ap-discussion
I got a penta as well as a dragon with it :P

I read your thread, i don't think we agree with each other on almost anything Morde does except the fact that he can go jungle and mid.

To elaborate on my summoner picks:
I sometimes pick ghost in the jungle to stay in range for early ganks.
Flash is simply riot's idea of an outplay button, so i take it much more often because lol wallhop lcs bigplays.

I wouldn't take cleanse (and by extension, tenacity items/ qss) because every team usually has more than one cc, and tbh the passive is too shit to stop focus fire. Instead, I simply don't rely on getting in melee for q, and just build to kill without it. In teamfights, attacking their frontline with it is enough instead of chasing their backline. Therefore, ignite (or exhaust) is superior because it is a combat spell for early kills and stopping healing.

I used to play full damage Kaiser, and I have to agree. You cannot play around Q's unless building more bruiser items, such as Sterak's and Abyssal.

I also agree that ignite is better than cleanse, just because level 1 ultimate can be out-sustained by a single potion. Also, because anyone who doesn't know how to play vs Morde tends to give him first blood at level 2 or 3 so long as the Morde player runs Stormraider's. :)

Y'know, I used to run stormraiders up until they started buffing masteries to thunderlord's level. Then I found out you can actually, quite literally, one-shot people with your ultimate with deathfire touch, or at least maim them to kill range from full hp or force them to b off their tower.

Okay so I've tried going down the ferocity tree, getting DFT to boost my ult. And MAN it raises the dmg for Morde's abilities so high. You know I thought I was gonna make a hybrid Morde, half tank half AP. But as it turned out the only really useful mastery in resolve is runic armour. But for the ignite + DFT idea it ain't really my kind of Morde so I'll keep my cleanse + ghost cuz I like to get in there and wreck azz. I use my Q all the time infact and that's why I need that cleanse. It really gets their health down fast and I don't need bruiser items due to the fact that I keep my shield going so I'm practically invincible as long as I can keep my shield going. Hence the cleanse. But anyway thank you for showing me that I'm an idiot and can't figure out Morde's masteries properly, it really helped.
Yup, full damage Morde ultimate is the bomb. I like that you can proc Luden's twice with it.

Just showing a different strategy which I mainly use in my games. I guess we build Morde in almost two seperate directions. I play him more as a fighter/AP carry kinda champ.  But if you got any suggestions on how I can improve this build I'll be glad to hear it.
Don't take this the wrong way, but your MMR is matching you with and against bronze players. I wouldn't recommend trying to teach the OP how to play his champion.
Not bad bro.. Keep it up!
